author: A_Brickset_user
title: STAPS good, but inaccurate
review: I got this set some time ago in England and I thought it was really cool. It was the set episode 1 I ever brought and I played with it for ages. I was reading a DK book on the ep 1 transport and I noticed when I reached the STAPS that lego were a bit inaccurate. It had the guns and body but they did not include the foot rampo and they engines on the side of the STAP. What I liked though was the swamp and although inaccurate the STAPS were call to. By now I have thousnads of Qui-Gon Jinn torsos and Jar-Jar torsos but I was them to create othe jedi and people form the movies. I will probaly never rate a lego set under 5 and beens this was my first set I'll give this set a 7 and a half. I really liked this small set.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: More Droids and Jedi Knight!
review:
This a very small set, but a good one!  I like the STAPs (Single Trooper Aerial Platform). They have nice detail and are very easy to hold! The Jedi Knight is cool, you get Qui-Gon Jinn with the green light sabre, and 2 battle droids, and Jar jar Binks. One of him is fine, but twenty, is another story! The sawmp details look like underwater reef plants, so they look kinda odd. This is another good set to build up droids!
A Pluming 10!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: More dorid, more Jedi, BUT NO MORE JAR JAR!
review:
I got this set at christmas a few years ago with the Ewok Attack, droid fighter and a few others. the set was sweet exspesaly the STAPs there sweet, the swamp was cool cause you can use it for other things then just naboo (like yavin) i already got millens of Qui-Gon's but his body is just perfect for any old jedi same with his lightsaber.
the only bad part is that lego had to but jar jar stinks in this set but luckly i found a use for him any way, i took out rocks the catapult in the Ewock Attack set and put jar jar in it and BOMBS AWAY! he went right across the living room. sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeet!!!!!! all in all this was a sweet set and worth the cost.

author: Jedi_Master_Fangorn
title: Where's Obi-Wan
review: This set would get a 5 if Obi-Wan was there.  Come on Lego, he wasn't floating around in the water watching the battle!  Oh well, this is from years ago.  STAPs are nice, another Qui-Gon Jinn, another Jar-Jar Binks.  Most Star Wars fans hate him, but I kind of like the guy.  The shell is really neat.  I think that there could have been more foliage, like some bushes, or some flowers, or something.  Another 4.

author: deluckybrick
title: Good army builder!
review: As I said before, this set is good to use in an army, and my Trade Federation army is'nt complete without the STAPs. Also a very good scene to play with, I would recommend doing that first, before putting it in an army. But somehow, the base never stays together!

author: Porsche911
title: Not bad for what it is
review: This set has a good array of characters and pieces and is a solid overall set. I found that the original trilogy sets are usually a little better than the prequel trilogy sets (probably because the moveis were better), but this is one of the better prequel trilogy sets.

author: brickbuster2409
title: my first set ever from starwars
review: well...this set wuz great!  some people say it reminds them of the '98(?) speeder bikes set that included luke in his endor outfit.  it does look alot like it.  great qui gon and droids. no real use for jar jar except for display.  does anyone remember the original price for this set? great backdrop and seaweed. awesome staps!  a real episode i classic.

author: hustla187
title: Close to Accurate
review: This is a great set but with a little bit of problems. First off, where is Obi Wan Kenobi? Second, I think the swamp should be a bit bigger. However, there are some great pieces in this set like the clam. This set isn't that bad, but needs Obi Wan.

author: sudorum
title: Swampy? Not So Much
review: For a small set, I'd say this is average. It comes with a decent amount of minifigures consisting of Qui- gon, Jar- Jar, and two battle droids. Considering the time period in which this set was released, I would have to say this set is fairly decent. The small sliver of swamp that is included is really underwhelming though. I don't know why Lego chose to call it the "Naboo Swamp". It should have given a more proper title, such as the "Naboo Ambush" or "Battle Droid attack."

author: Gus_263
title: Another Star Wars small
review: this set is another small set of the first lego Star Wars year. The set have a nice color scheme and a basic building. The four useful minifigures are two droids, Jar Jar binks and Qui gon Jinn. The droids aren't in the lego original minifigure shape, of course, but are in a good scale and design, with no much color and with details like the eyes and correct shape of the head. The Jar Jar minifigure is like other gungan minifigures, simple but with notable details. Qui Gon is one of the most rare star wars minifigures and is too simple, altough is nicely designed, that have also a cover, a cool lightsaber in green color and a hair. The droids still in two vehicles (i don't remember the real name now), that don't looks like much the same of the movie, but the minifigures stay well in it and it is playable. The few scenery builted above a blue plate is basic but with cool color scheme and pieces, looks like a simple lego style swamp. Overall the set is playable, altough have some old pieces, and it still good in design and have a simple building.

author: general_veers
title: Where's Obi-Wan?
review:
This was one of my first Lego Star Wars Sets, and I was not disappointed

Pros
Qui Gon
Jar Jar
2 Battle Droids
2 STAPs (Single Trooper Aerial Platforms)
Swamp scenery
The scenery has some rare parts
Good playability
Army builder
Cheap

Cons
Where's Obi Wan?
Needs more scenery
The STAPs should be more sleek

Minifigs-
Qui Gon- Has a green Lightsaber
Jar Jar- Good, but its a nightmare getting the head off of the body
2 Battle Droids- Cool

Get it if- 
Youre building an army, or you want a decent, cheap set

Dont get it if-
You want a bigger set

Playability- 8/10
Price- 9/10
Minifigs- 7/10
Construction- 9/10
Accuracy- 7/10
Design- 7/10
Overall- 8/10

author: jonbuddy
title: "Meesa go now!"- Jar-Jar Binks
review:
Not many Naboo sets out there. Hopefully people didn't pass them by on accident.

Good:
Jar-Jar Binks
2 Battle droids and STAPs
Qui-gon
Ultra Rare Orange Clam (UROC)
Scenery

Bad:
No Obi-Wan

Overall:
Get this if you can because it has rare things like Qui-Gon, Jar-Jar, and the UROC.

4.8/5
OR
9.8/10

title: good scenery
review:
nice set for gungan and droid army builder now pros and cons

droids
Qui gon

obi?
a whip

overall good for droid builder

clone commander trainrex over and out

author: CFL_fan777
title: Naboo Swamp
review:
Naboo Swamp is very good for a smaller lego set. It includes four figures: jar jar binks, qui gon jinn and two battle droids with back plates. The naboo scene is very fun to build and includes two trees, three vines, seaweed and a clam. The staps are kind of bulky but are great. They fit the droids well and the triangular piece on front makes them look all the better. Overall, it is a great small lego set and the build is fun and not at all repetitive. 

8.7/10

author: knuclear200x
title: "Meesa have LIGHTSABER!"
review:
I got this as a present as with most of the sets I owned during the days before I had a job. It's a simple set with a small backdrop and four mini-figs. The backdrop's pieces aren't as advanced, mostly consisting of brown and green basic blocks with a few seaweed pieces, a few green whips and a blue plate for the "water". 

Now the better part of this set. The two droids come with their own attack aircrafts each consisting of two horns, rods, and transparent support so it looks like they're flying. Then there's the cloth caped Qui Gon Jinn with lightsaber and that annoying Jar Jar Binks. What's cool is that despite being annoying, he's pretty cool to have. And you can give him Qui Gon's lightsaber. His ears limit the articulation of his arms though. But being a minifig, he doesn't look as crazy or flappy as his movie counterpart so you can be creative with him or pretend lightsabering him like in the ol' vidja game ;)

So this set gets points mainly for its minifig collection, while the backdrop is simply just a backdrop or spare parts.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Naboo Swamp Review
review:
This is my first LEGO Star Wars set I've got and I have to say it's a great little set. It comes with two nice STAP's which have a clear stand which makes them much cooler. This set includes two battle droids, Qui-Gon Jinn and Jar-Jar Binks. The swamp itself looks very nice as well. It's an easy build and we also get a rare shell piece which can be opened. It's a great set to have and it's also a good set for army building if you want to get it for the STAP's.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

         cool speeder things

                   i give this a 10/10

author: manny1134
title: Hey, you get Jar Jar
review: A nice classic set I recently picked up on ebay. I'm pretty sure this is the first set ever produced with Jar Jar in it. I like the Qui-gon Jinn figure as well. Definitly worth your money if you can pick it up for less that 30 dollars

author: AETerry
title: Meesa Jar Jar Binks. Whosa are yousa?
review:
And thus we're introduced to one of Star Wars most annoying characters and this set reenacts the scene in which Qi Gong introduces and saves Jar Jar... or you could go about with a rewrite of the script and he's not saved after all.

 

4 minifigures make up this set, Qi Gong, Jar Jar and two Battle Droids. So it's a good ammount for the size and price, which'd factor in that while you get to Droid Attack Pods (?), you have just enough to suggest a Swamp Scene. The parts you get aren't bad, you can take and use the pieces in other MOCs and builds, so it's worth it to me having this set in my collection and Jar Jar is amusing to have.

author: FloridaEggplant
title: Meesa your humble servant!
review:
Its been a long time since I got this set, all I remember is I got it at Canadian Tire, back when they sold lego. This set is good for scenery, you could make a swamp with this set.
It comes with Qui Gon Jinn, Jar Jar Binks, and 2 battle droids. Jar Jar Binks has a better
design in the new 2011 Battle of Naboo set.

 Pros

 -Clam
 -Vines
 -STAPs

 Cons

 None!

Overall, this set is good for scenery. It looks better on a green baseplate.

author: orybloodmyre
title: Great classic set and my first phantom menace set!
review:
I got this set before I had actually seen the phantom menace, and was convinced that Qui Gon was Anakin before he becomes Darth Vader, even though the booklet said 'Qui Gon Jinn'. I even argued with friends over it. I was an idiot child.

 

Though this set is simplistic, it is still pretty awesome. It isn't hugely movie accurate as only one STAP attacked Qui Gon, not two, and Obi Wan was there too, yet it is still a neat set. I remember being hugely impressed with the clear cannon stands that make the base of the STAPS and using them long after this set irreparably found its final resting place in my lego box.

 

I had no idea who Jar-jar was back then (wish I still didn't!) or the battle droids, but they still did battle with my endor speeder bikes and I deffinately had fun with this set.

 

It goes for quite a bit of money now on ebay, and isnt amazing enough to pursue it unless you want it for nostalgic reasons, like me!

 

As mentioned, although it was a small set, it did come with some unusual pieces that aren't that common. I have never owned another clam shell since this set, and was pretty impressed with the vines back then.

 

The phantom menace may have not been the best star wars film, but this set brings back fond memories!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Yousa Saved Me!
review:
Set #7121 Naboo Swamp: A small set depicting the scene from Episode One that introduced Jar-Jar Binks to the world. This set includes Qui-Gon Jinn, Jar-Jar and two Battle Droids. It is a fun little set and enhances your Episode One display.

 

Jar-Jar uses a whole new head piece, and Qui-Gon of course includes his trademark hairstyle. What you build in this set consits of a small portion of Naboo Swampland, with leafy covered tree trunks (I think.), and two STAPs. The initial version of STAPs look different compared to the newer ones.

 

Overall I'd have to say that this is a nice set to own, but it isn't 100% necessary for your Star Wars display, unless you happen to be a completist. Or want a lot of STAPs with various designs. The instructions also show off a few potential alternate models that can be built with the pieces in this set.
